# My-gStyles
My gStyles is an add-on for Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, and Slides) which allows you to create additional styles outside of the fixed list of provided styles in Docs, or in the case of Sheets, have any styles defined.

## Installation

<!-- TODO -->
> *Coming soon...*

## Usage

Use the gStyles menu to toggle the sidebar where you can save styles from selected text, or apply styles to the selected text. If no text is selected, the style under the current cursor will be used.

Each style has a name and a preview of what the style will look like.

### Saving Styles

1. Find a style on your document that you would like to save and select that text or place the cursor somewhere within that text.
2. In the sidebar, click ![the add icon][add_icon] and a text field will appear in its place.
3. Enter a name for the style into the text field and click ![the save Icon][save_icon].
4. The saved style will now appear in the dialog for later usage.

### Applying Styles

1. Select text whose style you want to change.
2. Find a style in the sidebar that you want to use.
3. Click ![the apply icon][apply_icon].

[save_icon]: data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[add_icon]: data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[apply_icon]: data:image/svg+xml;base64,
